info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 13 at 7:08PM CDT until June 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Carson County in the Panhandle of Texas... Southeastern Hutchinson County in the Panhandle of Texas... Northwestern Gray County in the Panhandle of Texas... Southwestern Roberts County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 706 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 16 miles east of Stinnett to near Borger, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. Largest hail should stay just north and east of Borger, but hail up to 2 inches in Borger will be possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect some tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * Locations impacted include... Pampa, Borger, White Deer, Skellytown, Kingsmill and Codman. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
